title: Programmer Information
message: Let's figure out which programmer you have. How many total LEDs are on your programmer?

title: Programmer Needed
message: You need a programmer to flash. Please purchase one from https://shop.hak5.org/products/o-mg-cable-programmer-usb-a-c

title: Flashing - Device Detected Issue
message: In the Web Flasher, are you receiving a "No Compatible Devices Found" error?

title: Programmer Cable Swap
message: The most common cause for this is that a "charge only" USB cable is used between the programmer and computer. Please try swapping the cable.

title: Firmware Assistance
message: To get this ticket started, lets get some info. What model OMG device is this about? (ex: Elite O.MG A to C Cable)

title: Firmware Assistance - Describe Your Issue
message: Please provide a **description** of the problem you are experiencing. Please include details about how the issue can be reproduced, the last time it was working for you, and other relevant info that will help diagnose your problem.

title: Firmware Assistance - What Operating Systems
message: What Operating System (version) have you most recently used to attempt to flash?

title: Firmware Assistance - Windows
message: Please open up `Device Manager` and look for the CP2102 Device. Is there a :warning: icon next to the CP2102 Device?

title: Firmware Assistance - Windows find Device Manager
message:
Lets try to help you find Device Manager

Please follow these steps:
1. Open up the Start Menu 2. Type `Device Manager` 3. Open up Device Manager If the above did not work: 1. Hit the Windows Key and R at the same time 2. In the Run Prompt type `devmgmt.msc` and hit enter From here expand the sections Ports and USB. Now, do you see a :warning: icon next to the CP2102 device?

title: Firmware Assistance - Windows Driver Install
message: Please follow this  [guide](https://github.com/O-MG/O.MG-Firmware/wiki#flash-the-omg-device) and reference video to setup the CP2102 Drivers. Once completed please try to flash again https://i.imgur.com/4CLUk5h.mp4
